intro: Gnaphalium sepositum, commonly known as the clustered bluemink, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky or sandy soils. Its small, blue to purple flowers are arranged in compact clusters, giving it a delicate appearance. The leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh native habitat.
